France and four other EU states will test an app to protect children online
subhead: The EU Commission announced that Denmark, France, Greece, Italy and Spain are set to test an app aimed at preventing children from accessing harmful content online by checking users' ages.

title: Brazil's far right is divided over Trump's threats
subhead: The US president's interference in Brazilian affairs, after he announced that he would raise tariffs on Brazilian goods to 50% in protest against the trial of Jair Bolsonaro, has fallen far short of uniting conservatives. Many insist it is necessary 'to set politics aside.'
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Rio de Janeiro (Brazil) correspondent)

title: At Paris' Grand Palais, Denmark and France collaborate through tapestries
subhead: The New Carlsberg Foundation commissioned four Danish artists to design 16 tapestries that will decorate Koldinghus Castle in Denmark. Crafted by weavers from the French manufactories of Beauvais, Gobelins and Aubusson, these works are currently on display in Paris.

title: Bastille Day in 1945: Versailles, the city of the Sun King, swept up in republican jubilation
subhead: '1945, A French Summer' (1/6). On Saturday, July 14, 1945, Versailles was celebrating as it had not done in years. But the carefree spirit of some clashed with the return of deportees and the restrictions still in place.

The dazzling legacy of iconoclastic jewelry designer Attilio Codognato
subhead: Known for his snake- and skull-shaped jewelry, the iconoclastic designer who died in 2023 also left behind an astonishing collection of works by Andy Warhol, Marcel Duchamp and Maurizio Cattelan, now fiercely protected by his children. His Venetian boutique, once a magnet for global celebrities, remains the only place in the world to find Codognato's singular creations.

title: At Rencontres d'Arles, the artistic blur between AI and photographers remains unresolved
subhead: The issue of works being plundered to train generative artificial intelligence search engines remains unsettled. Negotiations between representatives of creators and generative AI systems to reach a licensing agreement appear to be stalling.
